instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01598 no backlight.
threads.message:
Arrived with very little liquid damage on lcd connector. Works fine with external. 

PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT only .567V

D8410 pin 1 0.050V pin2 .567v

EDP_BKLT_EN 0V

No short to grounds and already replaced LCD cable. Screen and board connectors look good

PP5V _S0SW_LCD 5V

What next??

threads.title: 820-01598 no backlight.
threads.message:
3V3_S0SW_LCD present too?
Do you get image at least?
DP_INT_HPD goes high?

I bet for damaged CPU eDP output.
Check diode mode to ground on eDP lines of J8500.

threads.title: 820-01598 no backlight.
threads.message:
3V3_S0SW_LCD was 0v Replaced u8501 now 3V3_S0SW_LCD 3.3V

 DP_INT_HPD 3.3v pin 1 R4830 but 0v on pin 2. R4830 measures good.

LookS like Q4830 needs to be replaced. 

Im assuming Q4830 cant be replaced from A 820-00850 since this one uses a SSM6N15AFEAP and 00850 uses DMN5L06VK-7

Know any other donars by chance that have the correct chip or sounds like this will have to be special ordered??

threads.title: 820-01598 no backlight.
threads.message:
When trying a search for  SSM6N15AFEAP  almost nothing comes up. Digikey and mouser also do not have it.

Any idea where this can be ordered if not on any other donars?

threads.title: 820-01598 no backlight.
threads.message: Yes, checked diode mode to gound on all eDP lines. everything looks good there, no shorts

threads.title: 820-01598 no backlight.
threads.message:
looks like mouser has it, should this work even though end of part number slightly different then whats on the schematic?

[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.mouser.com/ProductDetail/Toshiba/SSM6N15AFELM?qs=sRdS99IVWC9N4cCQSvodnA%3D%3D[/URL]

threads.title: 820-01598 no backlight.
threads.message:
Just a dual N channel MOSFET in SOT563 package.
I bet all have the same pin layout.

threads.title: 820-01598 no backlight.
threads.message:
Don't expect the same voltage for XDP_DP_INT_HPD as for DP_INT_HPD; depends of DP_INT_HPD_MASK level.
Do not change Q4830 without reason.

As you now have 3V3_S0SW_LCD, check EDP_BKLT_EN and backlight output voltage.
